subject: Increase max wait time, avoid racy failure in gate

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Topic changed from bug/1552404 to glance-RC1

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Do we know exactly why these tests need more time to complete?

I'm always skeptical when the solution is just to update the timeout. Generally, I'd prefer to understand what test is taking longer and why before we increase the timeout because it might just need more time in the future and we'll keep increasing it without understanding the root cause.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I agree with Flavio on this one.
I'm not necessarily against raising the timeout, but without knowing what warrants this change, I'm afraid we don't have a good case.
Is "system workload" really the culprit?

Patch Set 2:

@Flavio/Hemanth: When the tests were written the tasks api was blocking and hence it always completed before the assertions were made. We then spawned the execution on a thread pool and hence the need for the wait time for those threads to finish.

I only see two alternatives :-
1. Monkey patch pool.spawn_n and make the tasks run in the same thread. But since this is an integration test, not sure if it makes sense.
2. Increase timeout as done in the patch.

Patch Set 2:

It's a good question. I will dig into it.

Patch Set 2:

Just did some investigation, and I think Sabari is right. So we need to make a decision which way we would like to go unless we can figure out another approach.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I have a question.
Could we use polling instead of checking status once?
It seems better alternative because timeout intervals are hardware dependent.

Patch Set 2:

Admittedly, this fix is a band-aid, but on the other hand, we're not necessarily waiting 10 sec, we're polling every 0.05 sec to see if the tasks have completed.  Kairait is right, this is going to be hardware dependent, so on decent/non-busy hardware, this will probably complete well under 10 sec.

The key issue here is what Flavio and Hemanth said, we don't want to increase this value continually, because that would mean that API performance is degrading, so we do need to set a cap.

I'd suggest raising the cap to 10 as Fei Long proposes, but add logging so that we can record which function is calling wait_on_task_execution and log how long the wait was for that function.  Then we can gather some data from the gate runs (or run a few thousand integration tests) to see what the variance looks like.

Patch Set 2:

I think we also need to bother about different openstack envs where Os admins launches tests. Timeouts for these tests are also hardware dependent and we can't gather statistics for them. So why couldn't we introduce timeout = 5 and maximum retries for example = 3 to ensure that tests executed correctly on all envs?
It looks like that Sabari did proper investigation and pool spawning requires some time to execute.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I believe this requires at least a much better commit log that summarizes everything that has been said in the comments.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Agreed on updating the commit message, specifically with why the timeout needs to be increased which AFAICT hasnt been figured out? It was mentioned that thread pooling has caused this, but that doesnt make sense to me - we are polling on task completion so the backend parellelism shouldnt effect the timeout length (and I would actually exepect it to be less now).

Patch Set 3:

Ah, sorry, I missed that that we are using retries already. Ok than an explanation in commit message would be ok for me.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi Fei Long,

Thanks for proposing this change. I agree to what you proposed. For any outstanding questions on why this is needed -- the original time for max wait of 5 sec was for task api when the task script had minimal work. Over time, we've introduced 3 flows that are run mandatory for each task create call. Hence, on slower nodes or busier schedules the task takes a bit of extra time to finish as success or to fail.

Fei Long, feel free to use the commit msg contents from my review. 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297865 . I abandoned it after knowing you'd a proposal already.

Let's get this one quickly and avoid further racy gate failures.
Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.
